#Text=Prune Ninebark
#Text=Ninebark is a popular shrub for landscaping because it is low-maintenance and it comes in attractive varieties .
#Text=It is also resistant to most plant diseases and grows easily .
#Text=If you have a ninebark , you will need to prune it at least once per year to keep it healthy .

#Text=Choose the best time to prune , identify the areas that would benefit from pruning , and use proper pruning techniques to ensure that your ninebark remains healthy and beautiful for years to come !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Choosing When to Prune Ninebark
#Text=Prune early in your region ’s growing season .
#Text=It is usually best to prune ninebark before it starts to develop too much , which will be sometime between late winter and early summer depending on your climate .
#Text=Consider when the growing season usually begins in your region to determine when to prune ninebark .
#Text=For example , if you live somewhere that starts to get warm around February or March , then you may need to prune early .
#Text=If it does n’t start to get warm until June in your area , then you may not need to prune until later .
#Text=Wait for flowers to appear .
#Text=Ninebark will start to flower early in the growing season , so this is a good indication that it is time to prune .
#Text=Wait for flowers to start appearing on your ninebark and then prune it .

#Text=Avoid waiting to prune for more than a few days after the flowers appear because this may damage the ninebark and the plant will start growing and expanding , which will create more work for you .
#Text=Perform light pruning in early summer to get rid of damaged and unhealthy branches .
#Text=After your initial pruning at the start of the growing season , you may need to do some maintenance pruning during the early part of summer .
#Text=Pay attention to how the plant develops and prune as needed to keep it healthy and looking its best .
#Text=Do not prune ninebark past the middle of summer because the ninebark will be entering its dormant phase and pruning at this time may damage it .
#Text=Identifying Where to Prune Ninebark
#Text=Remove dead and damaged branches and shoots .
#Text=Check the ninebark for any branches that have died or that are broken during your maintenance pruning .
#Text=Cut these down to the ground or as close to the connecting branch as you can .
#Text=Do n’t cut the branches down to stubs .
#Text=Remove them completely .
#Text=The leaves on dead stems and branches will be dry and crunchy or nonexistent .
#Text=Branches that are sick or dead may have flaky bark that looks different from the bark on the rest of the shrub .
#Text=Thin out stems and branches in areas that are overcrowded .
#Text=Check the interior of your ninebark during maintenance pruning to see how well the stems and branches are spaced out .
#Text=If they look crowded , then remove some of them to thin them out and promote healthier growth .
#Text=Make sure to cut them all the way down to the connecting branch .
#Text=For example , if you find an area of the shrub where the branches are rubbing together , remove a few of the branches so that they are not rubbing together anymore .
#Text=You may also notice that some areas of the ninebark are so full of foliage that no light can get through to the interior of the plant .
#Text=This may be the case even if the branches are spaced out .
#Text=Thin out these areas by cutting out some of the stems and their connecting leaves .
#Text=Eliminate weak or spindly shoots .
#Text=If during maintenance pruning you spot any shoots that look weak ( sagging or flimsy ) or spindly ( with few leaves or flowers ) , then remove these .
#Text=Cut them as close to the connecting branch as you can .
#Text=Do n’t leave any stubs .
#Text=Pruning shears work well for pruning shoots .
#Text=Using Proper Pruning Techniques
#Text=Choose the right tool for the cut you need to make .
#Text=The type of tool you use will depend on the area of the ninebark you are pruning .
#Text=Depending on the size of your ninebark , you may need 1 tool for shoots and stems and another tool for branches .
#Text=Some common pruning tools include :
#Text=Pruning shears .
#Text=Pruning shears are best for cutting through branches that are up to in diameter .
#Text=Loppers .
#Text=Loppers , or lopping shears , work well for cutting through branches that are up to in diameter .
#Text=Hand saw .
#Text=You may need a hand saw to remove branches greater than in diameter .
#Text=Some hand saws are even strong enough to cut through branches as thick as in diameter .
#Text=For anything thicker , use a chainsaw .
#Text=Disinfect your tools after using them .
#Text=To prevent the spread of diseases among diseased and healthy plants , it is important to disinfect your gardening tools after using them .
#Text=First , rinse your tools off with clean water .
#Text=Then , mix up a disinfectant solution made up of 1 part bleach and 9 parts water .
#Text=Soak your tools in the solution for 30 minutes and then rinse them off with clean water .
#Text=Let them air dry or dry them with a clean towel before storing them .
#Text=Cut branches nearly down to the ground .
#Text=It is important to cut any branches you remove near the ground .
#Text=Otherwise , they may hinder the growth of the ninebark and they will affect the appearance of the shrub as well .
#Text=You can even cut the entire shrub nearly down to the ground if it is out of control .
#Text=Make cuts in branches at about 45 degree angles .
#Text=Whenever you need to remove a branch , cut it at a 45 degree angle .
#Text=The lowest part of the branch should be even with the connecting branch and the highest part of the branch should be about from the connecting branch .
#Text=Leave the base of the shrub wider than the top .
#Text=It is important to leave the bottom of the shrub wider than the top of the shrub after you prune it or the bottom of the shrub will not get adequate light .
#Text=This could cause the ninebark to grow poorly .
#Text=Prune the shrub at a slight angle so that there is a gradual thickening towards the base .
#Text=For example , you could prune the ninebark into a pyramid-type shape with a rounded top .
#Text=Maintain symmetry in your pruning .
#Text=For aesthetic reasons , make your cuts with symmetry in mind .
#Text=If you cut a branch on 1 side of the shrub , make sure that the opposite side has a similar angle to it .
#Text=Step back and look at your shrub now and then to ensure that you are keeping it symmetrical .
#Text=Things You ’ll Need
#Text=Pruning shears
#Text=Loppers
#Text=Hand saw
#Text=Gardening gloves
#Text=Bleach
#Text=Water
#Text=Clean towel
